intro: Corydalis euchlamydea, commonly known as the purple corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial shade, often found in woodland or rocky habitats. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
